dialogue.raw_text: No sharks, m'lady.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is marvelous! Arthur, I want to come back to this very spot. Will you make a note of where we are?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Encouraged by the sight of the Woman and Arthur, and Vaughn's quiet urgings, people begin to wander into the surf, a few at first, and then a rush, as people plunge in and begin enjoying the pleasures of ocean bathing. The Selectman goes in, his family follows, Vaughn watches it all, beaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #7 Hendricks is on the radio while a Coast Guard spotter works the sonar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pan to the water.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Anything? Thought I saw a shadow. Over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As before, 400 pairs of enticing, yummy swimmers' legs, kicking like animated hors d'oeuvres.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW A breathtaking view. The copter spotter looks down with naked eye and binoculars.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing from up here, Daisy. Over.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (into walkie-talkie) False alarm. Must be this glare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - CLOSE ON BRODY He is walking down the beach, threading his way through the happy hordes. Meadows nods "hello."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A group of youngsters playing with Michael Brody's dinghy. They are hauling it toward the surf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael turns as Brody trots toward him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Who's scared to go in! I was in! Up to your knees, yeah -- So come with me -- I'll go again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Beautiful day, Chief!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey Mikey -- !
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not going to the ocean with that, are you son?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm all checked out for light surf and look at it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do me this favor just once. Use the ponds.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Dad, the ponds are for old ladies.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a favor for your old man.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (confused) Sure, Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - NEAR WATER TV cameramen are packing up their gear. For them it's a wrap
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - COUNTY POLICEMAN Suddenly his Walkie-Talkie fizzes, and the Copter Spotter's voice overloads the speaker.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Copter to Daisy! Red Four, Red Four!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: #7 - HENDRICKS Guns are up, heads turning everywhere.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Coast Guard sonar operator spots it and pales. A slick black dorsal fin is slicing a wake toward the swimming area.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (into walkie-talkie) Where -- ?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Went under your -- There!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus Christ -- Shark!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BRODY Rigid and choked, he almost breaks the "send" button trying to transmit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lifeguard in a loft behind him begins blowing on his whistle.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Everybody out! Out of the water, please -- leave the water, please --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: shouting hysterically.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No whistles! No whistles!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Dozens of bathers halfway out of the water, turn to see. More whistles, and they start toward shore. We hear panicky voices ad-libbing; "Shark," "Look Out," etc. The loudhailers sounding more urgent now, and a contagious dread seizes one person after another. Entire groups of people begin pulling toward shore, some of them obviously trying to control a growing hysteria in others.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #6 AND #7 are converging, heading toward the repellent line as if tracking an underwater shadow. The fin is beyond the repellent cordons and heading into the crowds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Caught on the other end of the line, he is wheeling in a broad, hot-dogger's circle turn, headed back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BATHERS People begin screaming. Kids are suddenly separated from their parents. Others seem to forget how to swim. One myopic little girl has her glasses bumped off and she begins to cry in blinded panic. Ellen Brody looks around frantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2, #3, #4 The riflemen in the boats are trying to get a bead, but too many civilians create a hazard. The Coast Guardsmen attempt to sever the repellent cord to gain access to the bathing area and the heaving fin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BATHERS This is a confirmation of our worst dread -- a full-blown headlong water panic. Screaming vacationers claw their way over the bodies of the less able. Some literally attempt to walk over the bobbing heads and glistening backs of others pulling for dry land.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: S - PANIC Horrified faces. Some are stunned and wandering in slow, tentative circles, while others are helped out by friends. Five people try to mount a rubber raft. Ugly reminders that each of us is Number One. Brody enters shot, yelling into his walkie-talkie, someone charges past him to help an old man out of the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dragging the helpless from the surf. Tears well in Brody's eyes. The screaming is deafening. The TV unit is hopping up and down in rage and frustration.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One thousand survivors pack the beach, standing absolutely still. A numbing cold sets in, and people shiver against each other. Muted sobs, whimpering, coughing. The six burly lifeguards huddle together like Cub Scouts.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why did we wrap? Get that! Somebody get that!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The monstrous black fin turns a slow circle as two Coast Guardsmen manage to cut their own repellent line. All boats converge on the dynamic fin. Men raise their guns to fire. Others adlib nautical commands in a uniquely calculated fashion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It slips sideways, revealing for the first time a tiny blue snorkel. Then appears the faces of two youngsters whom we will recall from the coven behind the dune. The fin bobs back, a beaverboard replica attached to a partially submerged surfboard. One youngster looks up and is greeted by:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Twenty rifles and shotguns pointed directly at him. Surrounding him on three sides. Some of the policemen start to lower their guns -- struck dumb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He throttles back suddenly, subsiding into his own wake, his eyes still restlessly searching.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his only defense, he begins to cry -- and feebly raises his hands in unconditional surrender.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The narrow estuary leading into the half-mile is rough today. Two children digging in the sand and unaware of the beach panic one hundred yards away look up, and the little girl points.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is cruising through the narrows and toward the busy pond.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He sees it, and jams his throttle forward. He steers with one hand, fumbling urgently for his walkie-talkie with the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: VIEW The circle of boats around the little pranksters, the crowds huddled on the beach, Hooper's boat suddenly arrowing towards the estuary, leaving a huge boiling wake.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He catches Hooper's boat out of the corner of his eye. Curious, he follows its progress. It's urgency finally communicates itself to Vaughn, who begins a shambling trot across the dunes towards a rise overlooking the estuary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vaughn gets there just in time to see the disaster. He watches, helpless, trying to shout, out of breath. Stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Michael is tacking full-sail in his boat with a friend, Kit. Kit is admiring the shark's tooth necklace around his own neck while Michael rubs some water on the scratches left by it. The fin, huge, black and real, crosses behind them. They are not yet aware. The fin seems to circle and return. It heads toward Michael's boat when another small dinghy gets in its way -- a weekend novice just finishing a thermos of coffee when he is "bumped." The entire boat is overturned. Michael sees the fin now as it collides with him, the entire bow lifting out of the water and rolling over on the port side. Michael and Kit are thrown head first. Three heads in the water come up sputtering, the fin between them crossing back. Michael freezes. The fin comes directly at him, growing into the sky, passing him so close he could touch it, but ignoring him as it follows the flailing and panicked weekend novice. Catches him. Michael watches. That all too familiar explosion of water -- a choked off scream -- the head and upper torso of the novice passing Michael swiftly as though being carried off -- a current of blood trailing behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A renewed cry of shark!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (passing a horrified Michael, who half extends one hand, as if to help) It's no good. I'm dead... (and he is)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He turns. Oh God! Running through the slogging sand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sudden turn. She runs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's got the walkie-talkie to his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three boats racing to carry out the orders. The black fin re- passing the two children, racing to get out. Hooper reaches the mouth before the others. The fin won't veer off. It smacks into the little vessel, bumping it aside. The fin is left racing into open water. Blood leavings. Hooper leaping over the side, slogging towards Michael.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Block the estuary! The estuary!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Copter roars in buzzing the shark, but too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They are pulling Michael out of the water as Hooper splashes up. Michael is conscious but in shock -- his eyes staring at nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People gather and Brody snatches beach towels out of their hands. They cover Michael and carry him off the beach, feet raised above his head.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (feeling his face) He's in shock. Get blankets!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Michael is wheeled out in the bed. Brody and Ellen are there. Sean is sleepy in Brody's arms. Vaughn is waiting in the hall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ellen exits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vaughn signs, and Brody takes the paper and exits.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: The doctor said it's okay -- mild shock. He can come home in the morning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Michael) Hey, big guy -- you want anything from home?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My cars. And a comic book.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sees Vaughn) Here -- (gives baby to Ellen) Take him home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Home... New York?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No. Home here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crossing to Vaughn) Got a pen on you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: There's only one thing you're good for anymore -- signing a damn voucher. Here. It's an authorization to employ a contractor.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know if I can do that without a...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) I'm going to hire Quint to kill the fish. I want to see that shark dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe we can save August...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget it. This summer's had it. Next summer's had it. You're the mayor of Shark City. You wanted to keep the beaches open. What happens when the town finds out about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was acting in the town's best interests...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The best interest in this town would be to see that fish belly-up in the water with a hole in his head. You do the right thing. You authorize me. (indicates paper) Right there. Whatever it costs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My kids were on that beach...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just sign it, Larry.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brody and Hooper are approaching Quint's house. They enter through the big wooden doors, into another circle of Hell. Smoke and steam from two big oil drums sitting over fires fills the air. Quint and his mate, Herschel, are grinding pieces of pilot whale into chum. The whale lies bloody on the floor, its ruined carcass adding to the stench of other sharks being boiled in the drums, their tails suspended in the air. Diesel fumes and decay fill the air, and tools, ropes, broken bits of iron and engine parts litter the floor. Wall hangings of rope and floats, and buoys, barrels, tackle and gear all conspire to frame the killing floor. Brody and Hooper navigate the obstacle course.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He emerges from the steam and smoke.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody tastes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Herschel interrupts. He's stopped working, and is wiping his hands on a bloody rag.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint wheels to face him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint turns to see this new voice, and starts walking towards him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper ties the knot effortlessly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He takes Hooper's hands in his own big bloody fists, and feels them as he talks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This has got to be one big violation...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (handling some gear) This is quite a place.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Keep your hands off my stuff.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Did you bring a check?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cash? Or do we do this on a handshake and a promise?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm authorized by the township of Amity to hire you as an independent contractor. We'll meet your price. $10,000.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And my regular daily rate -- $200, whether we catch him or not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And incidental damages, if any...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you get the Mayor off my back with this zoning crap. Nobody tells me how to run my property.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And, uh, a case of apricot brandy and you buy the lunch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Two cases. And dinner when you land.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pours drink) Try some of this. I made it myself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Here's to swimmin' with bowlegged women.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mr. Quint...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not goin'. No sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You want to get paid, you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Forget the money. You can't pay me enough. I ain't crazy. I worked some big mean fish with you, but I ain't goin' on this one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is the last time I hear from you. I don't want anyone with piss for blood on my vessel. Put that blackfish on board, pump the bilges, and top off the fuel tanks, and finish up in the morning. Then you're on the beach.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to need an extra hand...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Matt Hooper...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know who he is...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's from the Oceanographic Institute.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been to sea since I was 12. I've crewed three Trans-pacs -- QUINT Transplants?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: and an America's Cup Trials...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm not talking about day sailing or pleasure boating. I'm talking about working for a living. Sharking.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And I'm not talking about hooking some poor dogfish or sand shark. I'm talking about a Great White.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you now. I know about porkers in the water -- (throws him some rope) Here. Tie me a sheepshank.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't need to pass basic seamanship.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me see your hands...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ha. City hands. You been counting money. If you had a $5000 net and $2000 worth of fish in it, and along comes Mr. White, and makes it look like a kiddy scissors class has gone to work on it and made paper dolls. If you'd ever worked for a living, you'd know what that means.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Look, I don't need to hear any of this working class hero crap. Some party boat skipper who's killed a few sharks...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (interrupting) Hey. Knock it off. I don't want to have to listen to this while we're out there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What do you mean 'We...?'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's my charter. My party.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All right, Commissioner. But when we're on my ship, I am Master, Mate and Pilot. And I want him... (indicates Hooper) ...along for ballast.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Mate is loading. He hands Quint the items on his check list as Quint takes them aboard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As he talks, we see Hooper coming down to the dock. Wheeling a wagon behind him are two long-haired Research Assistants from the Institute. On the wagon, among other things, is a big shark cage. At dockside, Hooper checks his list, as he signs for his issue.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: 5 lengths of 1/2-inch, 20 number 14's, straight gaff, flying gaffs, tail rope, eye splice, M-1, 20 clips, pliers, irons...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Powerhead, CO2 darts, hypo, regulator, tanks, depth gauge, camera, extra magazines, cage...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You got everything you asked for?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper sees his gear approaching.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All of it. And thank Dr. Miro for me. And tell Borack I'll catch up with them in New Zealand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is actually a killing expedition?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: An eye for an eye, you know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Squirt! You want to stow this gear or you want me to use it for ballast? It ain't good for much but bait.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Assistant) I'll see ya. Tell Dorothy hello.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Quint sees Hooper approaching with the large cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper indicates "me."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper nods. Quint sings "Spanish Ladies" half to himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Junior. What are you? Some kind of half-assed astronaut? (to himself) Jesus Christ, when I was a kid, every little squirt wanted to be a harpooner or a sword fisherman. What d'ya have there -- a portable shower?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Anti-Shark cage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's inside, you or the shark?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're in the cage? (Hooper nods) The cage is in the water? (Hooper nods) The shark is in the water too? (Hooper nods) You're in the water with the shark.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Comin' aboard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: She's carrying a little plastic shopping bag, he's wearing shiny new foul weather gear, bundled up, sweaty, uncomfortable. She gives him as good a hug as she can manage under the circumstances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She straightens his coat, and gives him a shaving kit to carry aboard with his toiletries. From the deck, Quint whistles derisively.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody nods, and holds her hand for a wordless moment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a sputter and roar as the Orca's diesels kick on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They laugh together, and exchange a short, fierce kiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Its diesels chugging, the Orca pulls away from the pier. Ellen has already resolutely turned her back on it, and is walking off the dock back onto dry land.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Did you take your dramamine? (Brody nods) Here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up, Chief, daylight's a wastin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Ellen) Colorful, isn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You going to be all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nothing to worry about -- I'll survive this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll see you back soon. There's an extra pair of glasses in your black socks, and there's some suntan lotion and blistex in your kit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (sings) 'Here is the body of Mary Lee. For 15 years she kept her virginity. Not a bad record for this vicinity.'
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yo-ho-ho and a bottle of rum.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hugging him) What'll I tell the kids?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tell 'em I went fishin'!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Cast off the bow line! Now your stern!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Quint has set a course out towards the open sea. He lashes the wheel, and jumps down to address Hooper and Brody, who are standing together in the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He laughs at his joke. This is probably something he tells all his charters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts moving gear around, preparing chum barrels, setting hooks, Hooper gives him a hand, Brody stays out of the way.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Front-Bow, Back-Stern, Port, Starboard. Aloft, Below. It's not a staircase, it's a ladder, it's not a rope, it's a line, and if you don't get it right... (indicates porthole) I'll throw your ass through that little round window.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Now hear this. You're aboard the fishing vessel 'Orca,' and I'm her Captain, Master, Mate, and Owner. You'll jump when I holler. We're doin' a job here, and Christ, I ain't got time to watch you birds get hooks in your ass and fall overboard. Ship with me, and you'll do all right. Cross me, and I'll slap you upside your heads. Now -- if you boys are ready -- let's go fishin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is quiet as the Orca drifts along in the current, a wide chum slick spreading behind it. A couple of flag buoys spread along our perspective show us the miles the boat has gone. Quint spots something in the water -- a small blue shark attracted by the chum. He rigs a small pole with a piece of bait, and throws it over the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark takes the bait, Quint brutally and efficiently sets the hook, and reels the shark alongside. He hauls it part way out of the water, and sticks it with a gaff. Hooper and Brody watch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here's something for you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tailrope dropping on him. Gaffed and bleeding, the shark is immobilized by Quint's practiced hands. He takes one of his big knives and poses for a moment beside the struggling fish.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He slices into the shark's underbelly. We hear the sound of entrails plopping into the water. Brody is almost retching, and Hooper is just displeased.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: These greedy sons-a-bitches will eat their own guts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The gutted shark swimming in circles biting at its own entrails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fins closing in on the wounded shark.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Go ahead, you cannibals. Tell 'em where you got it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A boil of water and the flash of fins and teeth as the local sharks erupt in a feeding frenzy, jaws snapping, blood spewing, a sudden display of the fury and blind predatory drive of the fearsome species.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's that supposed to prove?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just a little appetizer. I want our porker to know we're serving. I want to put some iron into that big yap...
dialogue.name: dialogue

result.heading: HOOPER AND BRODY REACT AS WE DISSOLVE TO

direction.raw_text: The Orca is drifting in neutral. The ocean is like gelatin, the sun sucking heat waves from its surface. Brody at the stern, handkerchief on his head to protect from further sunburn, has been handed the slimiest job on a shark hunt: the ladling out of chum. There are several empty chum barrels. A flag buoy bobs in the wake of the boat, another waits to be tossed over the side. Brody is reeling with nausea. He opens his overnight kit and takes out a handkerchief and some Old Spice after-shave. He pours the after-shave into the cloth, presses it to his nose. Hooper is also in the stern.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint opens a can of beer and drains it in one long pull, crushing the empty and throwing it over the side. Hooper drains his coffee from a styrofoam cup, and cracks it in his hand with a silly "plup." He stows the pieces in an empty chum barrel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody goes to unlash a fresh barrel, but can't figure out the knots. He finally tugs on a piece of rope, and it all comes loose... barrel, shark cage, and, most important, Hooper's tanks, clattering and rolling on the deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: : LATER The men are in different positions on the boat. Hooper on the flying bridge. Quint in the stern, Brody hanging over the rail, puking. Quint takes a wide red strip of whale meat and a gnarled squid from the garbage pail, and searches for a No. 2 hook rig. He holds up a strip of whale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody shades his eyes from the white sun as Quint baits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint sits in the fighting chair. He casts off, murmuring as the line feeds out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Keep that chum line going -- we've got five good miles. Don't break it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who's driving the boat?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody. We're drifting with the current.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (using the fish finder) Nothing. Nothing, nothing, nothing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Hell, in the old days we went out with good charts, good sounding lead, and a damn good compass. Nowadays, these kids are afraid to go out without depth finders, radar, radio, electric toothbrush, every stupid thing...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Get a fresh barrel.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (jumping up) Watch it! Compressed air -- you screw around with one of those and Boom! Careful, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mutters) Real fine stuff but it won't mean a thing to Mr. Whitey, of course... he didn't go to schools in electronics. He was born with what he does best. Eat. He's a swimming appetite. 'Course he might eat this stuff, but then I've seen him eat a rocking chair, too. (to Brody) Next time, ask me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyeing bait) That's pilot whale, isn't it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It ain't a Big Mac. (to Brody) The expert don't approve. What do you thing? You're closer to the situation. (laughs)
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (croaky) Why are we way out here, when the shark's back there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (snapping bait to his leader) ...'cause this is where he lives. You gotta think like they do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) Easy for you -- they got a brain the size of a radish.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Now if he weren't around, we'd of hooked something else by now, wouldn't we? But he scared 'em all away. Big lonesome son of a bitch...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Quint at ease in his chair, Brody near him, practicing tying knots. The line starts to move, a few feet at a time; both men watch. Then the line whizzes off the reel. Brody jumps up. Hooper springs to the deck. Quint puts his hand on the drag and addresses the situation softly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint tightens drag and strikes. The line goes whizzing out. Brody runs to Quint's side. Hooper springs up to the flying bridge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody goes to get water, the boat surges, he staggers. Brody pours water on the screaming reel, nearly unspooled now. Hooper is turning the boat around and the line changes direction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper steers it sharply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again the line changes direction, down this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint reeling in like mad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He ad libs brief instructions to Brody as the line rushes out and there is less tension. Quint is horsing up and down, reeling in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The line is almost vertical, and Quint shows a hint of bafflement. He reels in suspiciously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper is rushing down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The leaders show above the water line. Brody is wide-eyed, waiting for that first look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper snaps the rope onto the leader and holds on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Before he realizes what's happening, Brody is clumsily clutching at the big rod, appalled. Quint skips away for a flying gaff. He picks one, turns... That's when the leader lashes free, sending Hooper crashing backward in a serious fall, and the rod whips at Brody's forehead, drawing blood. Quint snatches up the rod and reels in. The wires have been bitten through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper shakes off his dizziness and obeys. Brody watches Quint rig up a new leader, hook up the same bait.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody goes inside to inspect his forehead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: he'll gulp it down now... (making gulping noises) Hooooooo!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You got it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (turning with the pull) Get behind me, dummy! (shouts to Hooper) Reverse her and turn -- he's taking too much line! (to Brody) Wet my reel, quick!

dialogue.raw_text: (straining, muscles popping) Starboard, for Chris'sake --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Hey, you! Farmer! Half-speed there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (almost to himself) Aye, Aye SIR. Stand by to repel boarders. Poop the mainsail. Argh, Jim Boy.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Neutral! (to himself) Where the hell is he going?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, this ain't foolin' me -- (rod arcs down with a surge) Sure -- try it!

dialogue.raw_text: Makin' believe it's easy now.

dialogue.raw_text: Gettin' ready to run again -- no? No? (suspicious) What's he playin' here? (reels in furiously, to Brody) Put the gloves on! (to fish) Let's see who's gonna tease who now!

dialogue.raw_text: Let it go, don't waste your time.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Down here, Hooper!

dialogue.raw_text: (bathed in sweat; hauling, reeling) Look -- you may be a big Yahoo in the lab, but out here you're just supercargo, and you'll do as I say, or you can take your gear and backstroke home. Now get down here!

dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Unbuckle me -- fast! (to Hooper) Grab the leader. He ain't normal, this one... they never -- HOOPER It's too wild, too erratic. It's a marlin or a stingray. It's a gamefish.

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) A marlin, or a stingray. Huh. Don't ever tell me my business again. Get back up on the bridge.

dialogue.raw_text: (stunned) I'm okay...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Fasten the pole.

dialogue.raw_text: What's the point with hooks and Lines? -- QUINT Don't tell me my business! (to Hooper, points) Quarter-mile, that way. Full throttle.

dialogue.raw_text: (nursing forehead, gesturing at rod and reel) How -- if they're gonna keep on breaking?

dialogue.raw_text: What I do is trick him to the surface, got that? Then I can jab him, understand? (goes to flybridge, muttering) Think I'm gonna haul it in as if he's a catfish, like everyone else does?

direction.raw_text: - HOOPER AND QUINT QUINT (suddenly, pointing) Over there!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper cuts the engines as Quint swings nimbly down. He stands stock still on the main deck, motioning Brody to be silent. Then picking up the newly rigged rod, Quint softshoes it over to the chair. About to sit down, he freezes.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What do you see?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (still looking) At least you handle the boat all right. Stop. Here... Cut the engine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: looking hard at something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: staring, eyes widening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: moving in, surprised, interested, fascinated.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see the shark. First the fin... then the head and upper jaws, ten or twenty yards off the side of the boat. It finally submerges, its tail giving a final slap.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He puts his rod away and stares at it. And stares. And stares. Hooper is the first to break the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper is nearly beside himself with a strange ecstasy. He leaps toward his gear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint ignores him and moves off into the pilot house, where he swiftly takes out his green case, and opens it to begin to assemble something inside it. Brody is alone on the deck with Hooper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper is contained in his own excitement. He has finally come up with what he was looking for -- an expensive Nikon through which he peers intently at the shark alongside. He is talking half to himself as he fine-tunes the range finder and focus. He is squeaking and bubbling in an unsuppressed emotional boil.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: feet, if it's an inch...

dialogue.raw_text: feet. And three tons of him there.

dialogue.raw_text: What do we do? Get some help? Radio in?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How're we gonna handle this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (very, very high) There's a formula! Girth, about 150 inches, squared, divide by 800 -- son of a bitch, they are not going to believe this! -- divide by 2000... three tons! (after Quint) You're right, you old fart! Three tons! (ad libs ecstasy)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He is assembling the Greener harpoon gun, deftly screwing on the long wooden stock, the heavy steel barrel, and big shaft with the wicked barbs, the frame all rigged with line. Past him, on the deck, we can still see Hooper. As Quint is working with the gun, the radio suddenly squawks into life.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint snaps the mouthpiece to his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He snaps off the radio, and, for good measure, pulls the plug from the power source.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Amity Point Light Station to Orca. This is Amity Point Light Station, to Orca...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Orca here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I have Mrs. Martin Brody here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Put her on.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ...push this? Oh. It's working. Hello, Martin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is Quint, Missus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just wanted to know if you were all right... the Coast Guard let me use their radio. Is Chief Brody there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's busy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well... is everything all right?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just fine, Missus. We'll be back soon. Everything's fine. We haven't seen anything yet. Orca out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The big shark is slicing through the water just below the surface, its fin high, the big gray back glistening, the teeth gleaming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (on deck) Damn it! I need something in the foreground to give it some scale. Martin! Stand here! No, to your left! He is positioning Martin frantically, trying to include Brody, the shark, and the Orca in the same frame. Quint finishes with the gun, and as a final gesture, snaps an explosive cartridge into the breech. He empties the box of cartridges onto the table, snatches up a big handful, and drops them into a pocket, and heads out on deck, bound for the bow pulpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint appears with the harpoon gun. He throws one end of the line to Hooper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He indicates the barrels on the foredeck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint moves up toward the bow, Brody goes up to the flying bridge to take the wheel, Hooper starts for the foredeck, but stops to rummage in his kit, throwing gear around as he desperately hunts for something.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Here. Rig this to the forward keg up there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Get up there and steer her. Follow my hand, and hold 'er steady. I've got to get a clean shot at that porker's head.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry up, rig the line!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He finds what he's looking for. A small, powerful strobe unit, waterproofed, a miniature signal beacon. He triggers it, and it begins to pulse with a light we can see even in the sun. Hooper scampers to the foredeck and begins to rig the light to the first barrel, as the shark begins to surface near the bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He guides Brody with hand signals. Brody tries urgently to get it right, not to oversteer, to try to hold the big boat with its throbbing diesels on the course that Quint is indicating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper is rigging like crazy.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Come to port. Watch my hand. Steady now...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The line, man, the line!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Brody steering f.g., Hooper on the foredeck with the barrels, Quint leaning out over the pulpit, the gun at the ready, the shark crossing inexorably in front of them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agonizing over his shot as the shark approaches, glancing back to see if the line is properly rigged and Hooper is clear of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark is in position, Hooper shouts, a moment too late.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint fires. The harpoon slams into the shark behind his head, half-way along the back in front of the big dorsal fin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get clear, damn you!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Clear!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus H. Christ On a Crutch!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The rope snaps out in a blur of violent motion, Hooper jumps back, and the barrel leaps out of its rack, pulled by the line rigged to the harpoon. It bounds forward and into the sea, past Quint, who is already reloading, mounting another steel shaft. In the distance, the barrel bobs and skips violently in the water, dragged by the shark in his merciless moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - QUINT QUINT Now you've done it, you piss-ant. Stop and rig a goddam tinker toy to my gear. Let the bastard fight the keg for a while. He can't stay down with that on. Hooper, furious with himself, runs for the flying bridge to take the helm from Brody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper has snatched the wheel, and is ramming the throttle forward as he spins the wheel in a frantic 180 degree turn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes dart about the ocean, looking for the barrel, as he hot-dogs the ship around in a violent expression of his own disgust with himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He spins the wheel again, trying to make the big boat handle like a formula speedster. The decks tip and the rigging sways under the sudden strain. Brody is caught unaware, and tumbles off his feet, sliding across the deck to fetch up against a wall. the M1 Rifle is close to his hand. He stares at it.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: THE FLYING BRIDGE, BRODY AND HOOPER

dialogue.raw_text: (to Quint) Rig another keg! I'm bringing her around!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to himself) God damn it! We had him! (to Quint) I'm coming about!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hooper is anguished, intense, trying to find the shark, spinning the wheel, compounding his error, tipping the boat in rolling turns as he crosses his own wake. Quint has turned his back to the sea, and is in the pulpit looking up at Hooper, staring at him, excluding everything else. As Quint folds his arms and stares at Hooper, we realize the sun is going down, and it's getting dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper throttles back, and the roar of the diesels subsides and the boat resumes an even keel, slowly circling the ocean.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why don't we go in? Get another crack at him tomorrow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We got a barrel on him. We can't lose him. We stay out here until we find him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let's call in -- we can radio and have a big boat here in an hour...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (grim) You hired me, remember? It's my $10,000. It's my shark...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Throttled back to slow ahead, the boat circles the water endlessly, staying over the shark like an avenging angel. Its running lights gleam in the night, and a glow lights the interior of the pilot house. A bright strobe glints on the water winking once like a firefly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody and Hooper at the table, Quint at the wheel, keeping his eye on the light.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He corrects course slightly to keep the barrel buoy in sight. Hooper is sitting at the table, morose. Brody is staring at a couple of open cans of beans or beef stew, or some other crappy rations Quint has on board. Dirty spoons stuck in the open cans show us this has not been a formal dinner. Quint fumbles on the chart shelf and produces some of his home brew. He takes a pull, and hands it to Hooper, who takes a double. Brody touches the fresh abrasion on his forehead, where the fishing rod caught him. Quint bends forward and pulls his hair aside to show something near the crown.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody looks politely. Hooper stirs himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint is amused. He presents his own formidable forearm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody is fascinated. Quint and Hooper take a long pull from the bottle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He hauls up his pants leg, revealing a wicked white scar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts rolling up his own dirty pants leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody is drawn into their boasting comparisons. He secretly checks his own appendix scar, decides not to enter the contest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They toast each other. Brody looks around, sees the strobe blink once through the darkened window.

direction.raw_text: He starts lowering his pants to reveal a place on one hip where the tissue is scarred and irregular.

direction.raw_text: Brody lends a hand. The shirt slips part way off.

direction.raw_text: He drinks, Hooper follows.

dialogue.raw_text: That's not so bad. Look at this: ...St. Paddy's Day in Knocko Nolans, in Boston, where some sunovabitch winged me upside the head with a spittoon.

dialogue.raw_text: And I'll drink to yours.

dialogue.raw_text: Wait a minute, young fella. Look. Just look. Don't touch...

dialogue.raw_text: ...Mako. Fell out of the tail rope and onto the deck. You don't get bitten by one of those bastards but twice -- your first and your last.

dialogue.raw_text: Gimme a hand, here. I got something to show you --

dialogue.raw_text: (indicating his chest) There. Right there. Mary Ellen Moffit broke my heart. Let's drink to Mary Ellen.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And here's to the ladies. And here's to their sisters; I'd rather one Miss than a shipload of Misters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shows belly) Look a' that -- Bayonet Iwo Jima.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (aside) C'mon. Middle appendix -- QUINT (aside) I almost had 'im.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing) What's that one, there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (changing) Tattoo. Had it taken off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me -- 'Death Before Dishonor.' 'Mother.' 'Semper Fi.' Uhhh... 'Don't Tread on Me.' C'mon -- what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .S.S Indianapolis.' 1944.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's that, a ship?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulous) You were on the Indianapolis? In '45? Jesus...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Yeah. The U.S.S. Indianapolis. June 29th, 1945, three and a half minutes past midnight, two torpedoes from a Japanese submarine slammed into our side. Two or three. We was still under sealed orders after deliverin' the bomb...the Hiroshima bomb...we was goin' back across the Pacific from Tinian to Leyte. Damn near eleven hundred men went over the side. The life boats was lashed down so tight to make the bomb run we couldn't cut a single one adrift. Not one. And there was no rafts. None. That vessel sank in twelve minutes. Yes, that's all she took. We didn't see the first shark till we'd been in the water about an hour. A thirteen-footer near enough. A blue. You measure that by judgin' the dorsal to the tail. What we didn't know... of course the Captain knew...I guess some officers knew... was the bomb mission had been so secret, no distress signals was sent. What the men didn't know was that they wouldn't even list us as overdue for a week. Well, I didn't know that -- I wasn't an officer -- just as well perhaps. So some of us were dead already -- in the water -- just hangin' limp in our lifejackets. And several already bleedin'. And the three hundred or so laying on the bottom of the ocean. As the light went, the sharks came crusin'. We formed tight groups -- somewhat like squares in an old battle -- You know what I mean -- so that when one come close, the man nearest would yell and shout and pound the water and sometimes it worked and the fish turned away, but other times that shark would seem to look right at a man -- right into his eyes -- and in spite of all shoutin' and poundin' you'd hear that terrible high screamin' and the ocean would go red, then churn up as they ripped him.  Then we'd reform our little squares. By the first dawn the sharks had taken more than a hundred. Hard for me to count but more than a hundred. I don't know how many sharks. Maybe a thousand. I do know they averaged six men an hour. All kinds -- blues, makos, tigers. All kinds. (Pause) In the middle of the second day, some of us started to go crazy from the thirst. One fella cried out he saw a river, another claimed he saw a waterfall, some started to drink the ocean and choked on it, and some left our little groups -- our little squares -- and swam off alone lookin' for islands and the sharks always took them right away. It was mainly the young fellas that did that -- the older ones stayed where they was. That second day -- my life jacket rubbed me raw and that was more blood in the water. Oh my. On Thursday morning I bumped up against a friend of mine -- Herbie Robinson from Cleveland -- a bosun's mate -- it seemed he was asleep but when I reached over to waken him, he bobbed in the water and I saw his body upend because he'd been bitten in half beneath the waist. Well Chief, so it went on -- bombers high overhead but nobody noticin' us. Yes -- suicides, sharks, and all this goin' crazy and dyin' of thirst. Noon the fifth day, Mr. Hooper, a Lockheed Ventura swung around and came in low. Yes. He did that. Yes, that pilot saw us. And early evenin', a big fat PBY come down out of the sky and began the pickup.  That was when I was most frightened of all -- while I was waitin' for my turn. Just two and a half hours short of five days and five nights when they got to me and took me up. Eleven hundred of us went into that ocean -- three hundred and sixteen got out. Yeah. Nineteen hundred and forty five. June the 29th. (pause) Anyway, we delivered the bomb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint has just finished his story, and we are looking across the quiet night sea to the Orca slowly circling in the night, the warm light in the pilot house barely revealing the figures of the three men inside, the red and green running lights winking along the ship's flanks. We hear the distant boom and drawn-out hoot of a whale.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What the hell?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a brief, eerie pause. Quint breaks the silence by muttering into song, which he slowly swells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gradually, Hooper and Brody join in, and the pilothouse becomes a warm cozy place.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: It's a whale out there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (singing) Show me the way to go home... I'm tired and I want to go to bed. I had a little drink about an hour ago, and it went right to my head. (etc.)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Orca and its song in the night. In the foreground, the barrel and strobe light flash up into view, and behind them, the big dorsal fin surfaces, and glides ominously towards the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The song is continuing, and we hear the barest hint of a scraping sound from the hull deep beneath the men. Quint's eyes abruptly narrow as his sensitive ears are the first to hear the abrasion of his ship. Things vibrate on the shelves. Quint stops singing, Hooper and Brody continue a duet. The scraping repeats, and Hooper now senses it. He drops out of the song, leaving Brody singing solo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Brody hears this and is about to stop singing, the boat is suddenly bumped from below, and the gentle scraping turns to a violent assault somewhere on the understructure of the vessel. Water bubbles up into the hold. Brody starts, and looks at the radio. He is about to move towards it when Quint's urgent instructions stop him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaves Brody in the pilot house, and runs onto the deck, grabbing his M-1 rifle as he goes. Brody hits a switch and we hear the pumps starting.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (quietly, to Hooper) Start the engines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's busting the shaft! Start the pump!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Where...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The bilge pumps. There --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hooper is on the flybridge, starting the engines, but the diesels sound wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boat is assaulted again. Quint fires over the stern, emptying a clip into the water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody moves cautiously up to the bow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper stands ready on the bridge, Quint pacing the stern deck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He jams a fresh clip into the M-1. The men scan the seas around them. Quint resumes their song, louder this time, more defiant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper and Brody join in from their respective positions.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Cut the engines!

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) Get up forward! Watch for him!

direction.raw_text: . OCEAN, WIDE ON THE ORCA The men in place, singing, the water sparkling towards the horizon, the stars twinkling above. The sound of a distant whale in distant counterpoint.

direction.raw_text: Brody is at the wheel on the flying bridge, while Hooper and Quint have a hatch up on the stern, and are working together to repair the damaged rudder controls torn loose by the shark. Hooper is bucking the steel rod, while Quint is hammering away at the joint, trying to drive a new pin. The engine is idling. Bits of iron clutter the deck, along with a few rough, outsized tools and greasy rags and gaskets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody tries to comply.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint hammers again.

direction.raw_text: And we can. The Orca's diesels are no longer smooth. Brody suddenly sees something, and points.

dialogue.raw_text: He's bent the housing. You can hear it.

direction.raw_text: - THE WATER The barrel is surfaced directly ahead of them, just off the port side. They are drifting up to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The strobe light winks at them. Quint holds up a hand: "Quiet!" Everything stops as they watch the barrel coming slowly up on them.

direction.raw_text: He takes a killing lance from the rack. Hooper gets a boathook.

direction.raw_text: Hooper leans out gingerly, snagging the barrel with the hook. It bobs lightly in the water, an innocent bystander. Hooper shifts his pole, takes hold of the rope, poling it in.

direction.raw_text: Hooper gets the line and starts hauling it up. No resistance. It comes easily over the transom into a coil on the deck. He and Quint exchange looks.

dialogue.raw_text: The barrel!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's under the keg. Careful --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (suspicious) Easy -- just want to goose him up. The minute he runs, drop it or you'll lose your hands.

dialogue.raw_text: Here -- gimme. I don't see what he's been doin'.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - ANGLE Both men are draped over the side, their chins almost touching the water on the aft side. From the opposite starboard direction, fully unfastened from the barrel, comes the Great White. First the fin, then the conical nose and the upper border of wide, grinning teeth. It knifes through the water in absolute silence, propelling itself with tremendous speed toward the unsuspecting men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His instincts shine -- as does his newly-acquired sense of direction.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (top of his lungs) Shark! Starboard!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: They turn just in time, and a long spine-stretch saves them from instant decapitation. The Great White passes the transom, the harpoon still in its side and trailing five feet of chewed- off cable. It rolls on its side and looks at them as it passes. Past the stern the huge tail lashes out, ripping the rope out of Quint's hands, shearing a huge swath through the paint, peeling it off like a plane, taking one of the bronze letters out of "Orca." The shark begins an arc to sea, its fin cutting the water, and starts circling the boat. Quint notices his cut hand, palm bleeding, realizing how close he came to losing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The diesels start with a terrible grinding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper slams the hatch, kicks the tools to one side, clearing the deck for action once again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody heads for the radio in the pilot house.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Haul in that rope -- it'll foul us! (then to Brody on the bridge) Start the engine!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Easy! It'll tear right out!

dialogue.raw_text: (hauling) The shaft is giving.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (on bridge) That's it! Radio in for help!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up! Just pump her out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (coming down off the bridge) Yeah, Captain, as soon as I make a call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A perfectly terrible look comes over him. He raises up and starts after Brody. Brody disappears into the cabin. Quint pauses outside and sees:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: his calloused hand grabs it up fiercely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody picks up the radio, flicking on knobs and lights on the complex console.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: CLOSE - BRODY looking up in horror, covering his face.

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Beg your pardon --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Duty first and pleasure after --
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Quint brings down the bat with all the strength he can summon. Crash! Sparks fly, lights blink and go out, plastic and sections of metal ricochet all over the cabin as Quint demolishes the ship-to-shore radio. Quint takes a happy breath, winks at Brody and hands him the bat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody's adrenaline turns his fear into rage. His glasses are cracked or broken by flying pieces of radio. He seizes the bat, and pound the shattered radio for emphasis.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His tirade is interrupted by an urgent bellow from Hooper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Excuse me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Some great idea! Now where are we? Some goddamn skipper you are. You're certifiable, y'know that? You're a real treat! Certifiable! Bananas!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pointing at the fin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ANGLE - OVER THE BOW QUINT (raising harpoon) Hard to port! Hooper pulls the boat into a tight turn and Quint has a shot at the upward rolling flank. He sinks it with careful precision.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody emerges from the cabin as the rope zips overboard, and the barrel, changing over, catapults into the air before plunging into the ocean in a cloudy splash.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Coming right to us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No -- comin' right at us! Slow ahead, he'll hit us head on -- (the engine clanks) Slower! Throttle back ---
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Try shakin' that out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting to Quint) Did you get him in the head?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Brody) No! No! No! (to Hooper) Swing around! After him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hooper can see the fin racing ahead of the barrel. Diving down. Up again -- Quint prepares another iron. Brody is digging in his bag. He comes up with his 2" .357 service revolver.

direction.raw_text: The engine thuds and knocks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the barrel gongs into the side of the Orca.

direction.raw_text: Hooper skillfully avoids the speeding rope.

direction.raw_text: Quint leans to one side, harpoon over his head. The Great White breaks water and...

direction.raw_text: He sinks it deep. We hear shots. As the new rope whips out, Brody can be seen standing on the gunwale, in regulation police combat pistol stance, holding his .357 in both hands, firing at the shark's head. Quint shakes his head in amused disbelief at this, as the barrel goes over.

dialogue.raw_text: More gas... go to half! Get me right alongside him --

dialogue.raw_text: Watch it!

dialogue.raw_text: Atta boy!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take two, they're small!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting at Brody) Don't shoot him any more! He's crazy on his own blood already!

dialogue.raw_text: I can't stand here doing nothing!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Order in the court!

direction.raw_text: He has seen the two barrels pop to the surface.

direction.raw_text: He yells to Hooper and Brody as he swings behind the controls.

direction.raw_text: Quint steers "Slow Ahead," engine protesting, as he maneuvers toward the moving barrels. Quint peers down, steering closer and closer.

direction.raw_text: Together Brody and Hooper hook a barrel-rope and hold on for dear life as the shark changes course.

direction.raw_text: Brody and Hooper pull in with all they are worth as Quint helps out by wheeling in a circle. He laughs to himself, enjoying the spectacle.

dialogue.raw_text: (racing over) Three'll do it! He's havin' trouble with two!

dialogue.raw_text: Get ready! Now snag 'em!

dialogue.raw_text: Pull in the ropes and tie 'em onto the transom -- free ride.

direction.raw_text: securing the rope to a cleat but allowing the barrel to hang overboard. Brody ties his now-perfect bowline adjacent cleat.

direction.raw_text: The boat is jarred violently from side to side as the underwater force of the Great White jerks and heaves them to and fro, up and down, side to side...

direction.raw_text: are both torn off their feet as the boat is thrust forward.

direction.raw_text: - QUINT sees the fin ahead. It is pulling the boat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark leaps partially out of the water, and the sight is both horrifying and awesome. Its jaws break water, snapping at the ropes that have him snarled and frustrated. Quint throws the Orca into neutral and shouts down:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that, Quint slides down to the prow, putting another shaft onto his gun, finding satisfaction in its heft and balance. The shark can be seen directly ahead, threshing closer.

direction.raw_text: He fires the iron, and the shark veers downward in a gushing shower of spray.

dialogue.raw_text: Get tired! That's the idea! Here's a little reverse for you!

dialogue.raw_text: Haul in -- watch the prop!

dialogue.raw_text: Now! Untie 'em! Quick! He'll tear us to pieces.

direction.raw_text: They are trying to untie from the cleats, but both ropes are stretched too taut. They jump out of the way, falling flat on the deck as the ropes sweep over them, knocking over objects, skeetering across the deck. A tight jerking motion, and the Orca is dragged through the water -- backwards. And much too fast. Water is splashing up over the transom in its backward wake. The engines groan and complain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wrenched to one side, Quint is knocked from his feet.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Damn head is too far away. He's too big.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A moment of slackness, and then a great surge of raw strength. The rope snaps the cleats off, screws and splintered wood spraying -- and the barrels fly over the water. They disappear beneath the turbulent grey surface. The three men, breathing heavily, bruised and pouring sweat, look out at the blank water.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pop -- pop -- pop. One, two, three, the barrels surface -- ready for more.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody looks down at his feet. There is salt water up to their shoe tops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The barrels start a wide circle, each cuts through the water, pushing a wave before it and leaving a wake behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint tosses Brody the hand pump, then picks up his M-1, and checks the load.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (amazed at the shark's strength) He can't go so deep. Not with all those on him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What about us?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (mentally assessing the damage) Have to pump her steady, s'all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Follow him -- (to Brody) You start pumpin' out here.

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) (on bridge) He's heading under -- !

dialogue.raw_text: (incredulously) No way! He can't!

direction.raw_text: The barrels approaching the Orca dip below the surface, one -- two -- three.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody looks around. Hooper on the flying bridge searching in all directions. Quint is looking more appalled every second.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Booming thud at the keel. Brody slides on the wet deck and Quint loses his footing, falling into Brody's arms.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Where'd he go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (helplessly) He can't stay down with three barrels on him! Where is he?!

dialogue.raw_text: Have you ever had one do this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (and he means this) No!

direction.raw_text: It seems the only place out of reach of the shark. Quint climbs up, Brody following him, reloading his pistol. Just then, the barrels pop up ahead, veer left, and duck under.

result.heading: WITH HOOPER ON THE FLY BRIDGE

dialogue.raw_text: Follow him!
