dialogue.raw_text: He's under!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There! (points wildly) The barrels have surfaced and we see the monster shadow sliding under the Orca, seemingly endless. Violent scraping sounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quint is grimly silent. Brody senses that Quint is in the fight of (and for) his life. The Orca taking evasive action. But the three barrels are closing the gap, the engines coughing and missing, destroying themselves with every rotation of the damaged shaft.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's chasing us! I don't believe it. QUINT Full throttle! To port!
direction.name: direction

result.heading: BRODY AND HIS POINT OF VIEW BRODY

dialogue.raw_text: He's trying to sink us!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Hooper) Dead astern! Zig-zag!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Hooper is jamming the throttle forward, but the engine is pounding and knocking wildly. The barrels circle and move in. Quint has his rifle ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leaps to his gear, trying desperately to get his dart gun. Just then, the shark attacks, breaking water and rising over the boat like a rocket; snout, jaws, pectoral fins, belly, falling sideways. A vast spray drenches the men. Quint fires into the belly, the bullets pocking the smooth whiteness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Orca shudders from side to side. From Hooper's point of view we can the shark gripping the transom in his jaws, shaking the boat as he saws his massive head from side to side, trying to tear a chunk out of the very hull. Quint has reloaded and is firing into the fish. Brody has a wicked pointed gaff, and is swinging wildly at the snout, gashing and gouging it, trying for the eyes. The killing lust is on all three men.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The boat surges, the shark gives a final unbalances wrench, and disengages. The dorsal fin circles off, beginning a wide loop around the boat. The engine quivers and dies, the boat without power, rolling half awash, a wounded victim. The fin dips, the barrels follow, the shark disappears beneath the waves. There is complete silence.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (suddenly giving Quint the wheel) Hold her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (loading) Keep him there! Keep him!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Throttling back!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: In the dead quiet, we can hear the lap of waves against the hull, the hoarse panting breathing of the men, the pings and pops of the cooling, dying engines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He eyes the stern. Huge cracks and broken timber testify to the fury of the attack.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (very quietly, to Hooper) What can that gun of yours do?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Power head with 20 ccs of strychnine nitrate. If I can hit him. I can kill him. But I gotta be close. Very close.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (the awful realization) You gotta go in the water...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Quint and Hooper are assembling the shark cage, its shiny bars the only undamaged things on deck. Brody is working too, bolting the sections together.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The men are speaking in near whispers, quiet in the silence that surrounds them. Hooper is in his wet suit, adjusting weights, mask, tanks, etc. The cage is standing in the stern. Quint runs a line from the gin pole to the roof section. Hooper climbs in though the top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Brody cranks the winch, hoisting cage and Hooper into the air. Quint balances the gin pole lines, Hooper crouching in the cage, examining it for stresses; satisfied, he holds out his hand. Quint puts the spear gun into it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in command now) Rig the cable to the roof eyebolts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Take me up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He examines his weapon, checking the power load, with the big wicked-looking syringe head uncapped to reveal its razor point.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hooper inside, looking out the bars of the cage, gives Brody a reassuring smile, then pops his mouthpiece between his teeth and checks his regulator. Brody steps back, and with Quint guiding the cage, begins lowering it off the gin pole boom arm into the sea alongside the boat. Brody and Hooper stare at each another as their faces pass, Hooper sliding down into the cold grey ocean. As Hooper disappears beneath the surface, Quint and Brody exchange a long look between them.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Lower away, Chief. (then, to Quint) Try and keep him off me till I'm under.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Submerging. The sky, horizon, water line, clean fresh sea air then... the magnificent innerspaces, with bubbles sparkling in front of us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as he floats to twenty feet Hooper never stops looking around 360 degrees. He removes the rubber guard from the needle and waits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their turning heads tell us that the barrels are still circling. Suddenly, both heads stop turning.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The barrels have come to a stop. Delicately, they change course and meander toward the lowered cage.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His back is to us. He is just now completing a visual sweep and turns, eyes front into closeup and: fixes wildly on something monstrous... and fascinating.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The water is clear and shafts of sunlight streak downward in the blue. From the deep gloom -- diving slowly, smoothly -- comes the shark. It moves with no apparent effort, sinuous beyond comparison. As it nears the cage, it turns, and its ghastly length passes right in front of him: first the snout, then the jaw, slack and smiling, then the black eye. Hooper tentatively reaches out. It is too far for the strychnine pole. The vinyl flesh is pocked with bullet holes, iron scars, gaffing hooks and strange open wounds that tinge the passing currents with pink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The trailing barrels gong and scratch the keel of the Orca above. Brody and Quint leap back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark has vanished into a cloud of rising silt. Hooper, expecting the shark to attack out of that same general direction, braces himself, pole extended through the bars, breathing faster, straining his eyes into the gloom and... we see that the shark attacking from behind him. The cage is sent careening. Hooper grabs the bars for dear life. The shark has grabbed the steel struts in its brutal jaws, shaking the cage relentlessly from side to side, bending the bars like clothes hangers. Hooper can't turn the pointed end of the pole around, his body jammed as far away from the non-rational attacker as possible. Hooper is trapped. The shark withdraws to get some running room then charges again. The bleeding snout thrust deeper into the yawing bars, the jaws snapping and twisting, two feet from Hooper's torso, the tail thrusting it forward. Hooper drops the strychnine pole between the bars and it tumbles slowly toward rapture depth. All the shark needs is one more good thrust before separating Hooper at the waistline. Through frantic bubbles Hooper fumbles with the overhead hatch cover, kicking up and out of the cage. The shark backpedals with its tail, but the broad head won't shake loose. Hooper rushes downwards, after the strychnine pole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark twists free of the cage and arrows downward after Hooper. Hooper nearly recovers the pole. Again it slips from his frightened grasp and this time disappears into a narrow abyss. Hooper turns and looks up. The Great White is lunging at him, twenty feet above.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One of the barrel ropes snakes around the cage rope and pulls taut.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DEEP Turning to meet the monster which -- though held back for a moment by the snarled rope -- now surges forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BRODY AND QUINT The Orca is listing dangerously aft, the ginpole bent almost to the breaking point. Brody is in a frenzy trying to haul up the cage. Quint attaches the end of Brody's rope to a hand-winch. The ginpole is splitting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pole gives way, the rope whipping down on the gunwale... the pulling of the tonnage below is tipping the Orca, dragging it, but Quint won't give up the winch. Brody hauls on the rope barehanded.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let go of it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: maneuvering downward, away from the jaws... Suddenly the crazed shark veers upward for the surface.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - QUINT The winch is working faster now, Quint demonically winding it in. The crushed cage bangs against the hull then breaks water. Brody is horrified. The cage is empty!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's comin' up -- !
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's taken him!
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (a horrible scream)
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The shark breaks water right beside the Orca, rising with a great whooshing noise. It rises vertically, towering overhead, blocking out the sun. The pectoral fins seem to reach forward. The shark, in all of its monstrous glory, falls onto the stern of the boat with a shattering crash, narrowly missing Quint and Brody. It drives the stern underwater, the ocean pours in over the transom. The jaws snap from side to side. Brody flounders backwards away from it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is clinging to the mast for dear life, as the ship begins to tilt to stern, and everything starts to break loose around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The giant jaws are snapping irresistibly at everything: great chunks of wood torn out of the deck and superstructure. Deck chair, irons, rope, gear, beercans, bottles, Brody's bag, all are food for the insatiable maw blindly churning away. Quint is clinging next to a rack of lances: he is enraged at this ultimate violation of his territory. He snatches up a lance and hurls himself at the shark with a wordless bellow. The great head weaves side to side, the deck is at a treacherous incline, slippery with blood and seawater. Quint's footing falters and slips, he stumbles at the Mouth of Hell, the big teeth seize him and snap. Quint's roar of rage and pain is choked off as his body is clamped between the grinding, sawing teeth, and his head and legs suddenly contort as the shark's teeth meet across his torso. Blood gushes onto the deck. The remnants of his body tumble from the shark's mouth. Brody sees the horror, hears the screams -- in his desperation, he tears loose one of Hooper's remaining air tanks, and hurls it at the monster. It tumbles into the bloody well, wedging across the back of the mouth, the thick steel blocking the cruel jaws. The shark's head shakes even more violently, trying to clear the cold iron, but the tank is in to stay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To avoid sliding into the jaws, Brody scrambles on the titling deck, bracing himself in the cabin door to avoid pitching down into the bloody mouth. He fights his way into the cabin, already a shambles. Below him, on the deck, the shark lunges again, shifting weight so that the boat in now stern down, and listing to the side. Water from the sea pours into the cabin. Another lunge by the shark. The huge snout and jaws slam up against the doorframe, blocking escape, bloody, gnashing. More seawater. To stay in the cabin is to go down with the ship. Brody clambers as far from the shark as he can, against the forward wall of the pilothouse. He sees the window Hooper used before. It's blocked by barrels and debris. He breaks the side window highest above the water, edges out onto the battered bridge. The shark rolls around, now half in the water. The ship is sinking, the sea is not a viable alternative. Brody climbs up into the flying bridge. The shark is still lunging and snapping. Brody is forced to climb higher and higher as the ship slowly sinks beneath him.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: DECK OF THE ORCA, LISTING BADLY

direction.raw_text: He scrambles for his life onto the flying bridge, sees the M- 1 stuck there, seizes it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He is bracing himself, aiming the rifle, taking a bead on the steel tanks, silver gleaming in the bloody shark's mouth. He fires. And fires. Bullets shatter the shark's teeth, punching holes in the dripping snout.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: OVER BRODY, LOOKING DOWN AT THE STERN

direction.raw_text: With a muffled boom, the perfect symmetry of the shark is suddenly blown apart in a geyser of steel and blood as Brody's shot hits the pressurized tank. A 30-foot cloud of water, steel, shark and debris covers the sky. A gigantic convulsion hurls the Great White's mangled body into the sea. The Orca slowly begins to turn over in its death roll.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The shark's carcass floating down in a cloud of blood and debris. A shadow clouds the waters, and the Orca's mass begins to slip into the frame.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Emerging from beneath the surface, he raises his mask, spits out his mouthpiece and kicks toward Brody.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - BRODY AND HOOPER Brody is holding onto a cushion, barely afloat, relieved the shark is dead, yet stunned to see Hooper is still alive. The two men share weak laughter, which soon trails off.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Quint...?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... (notices something O.S.) You think we can get back with those?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - BRODY AND HOOPER - ANOTHER ANGLE They swim through the debris, using two barrels as floats, as dozens of seagulls feast on shark remains on the surface.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What day is this?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Wednesday... No, it's Tuesday, I think.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Think the tide's with us?
dialogue.name: dialogue
